result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jason J. Hunt in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
17CF40, 17CF33, 16CF86, 16CM135 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the revocation summary was received.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant was part of the Treatment Court Program and because of that, the defendant would have the right to ask for substitution for the DA and for the Judge.  Court questions the defense.  Atty Stamman would like this taken care of today and does not request substitutions.  Atty Stamman is prepared to proceed today.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Stamman makes sentencing arguments.
Atty Hendee asks that the DPA be terminated due to the defendant did not complete the Treatment Court Program.  Atty Stamman stipulates to the termination.
BY THE COURT:  DPA on Ct. 1 in 16CF86, and Ct. 1 in 17CF40 to be terminated; motion granted, defendant is found guilty.

BY THE COURT:  16CM135 - Ct. 1: Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent
17CF33 - Ct. 5:  90 days in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent
17CF40 - Ct. 6:  Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent
Credit = 174 days on all cases including the felony cases
Time Served
Costs in all cases to be converted to a civil judgment

Ct. 1 in 16CF86 and Ct. 1 in 17CF40:   Court orders 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to each other and concurrent 
Court Costs = $268.00 on each count
DNA Sample + Surcharge of $250.00 on each count
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Comply with any and all counseling as recommended by the Agent
Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid perscription
Restitution to be paid while on Extended Supervision

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Defendant Jason J. Hunt in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Defendant Jason J. Hunt in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
17CF40, 17CF33, 16CF86, & 16CM135 
Atty Hendee makes statement.  States new violations to treatment court program.  States he has not been able to file the new paperwork for the motion to terminate treatment.  Atty Stamman makes statement but will argue his position.
Atty Hendee argues for termination of treatment court program.  Atty Stamman stipulates to the positive testing; however, argues against termination.  States the positive strides of his client.  
Court states it's concerns to defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Court does not believe the treatment court program is the right fit for this defendant.  Court will terminate the defendant from the program at this time.

Atty Hendee states as to 17CF40, Ct 6:  There was 6 months jail stayed to be used for sanctions and there have been 36 days used as of today.  Requests the stay be lifted on the balance of that sentence and defendant should serve the remaining 144 days.  States he will be filing motions today to terminate the DPA in 17CF40 and 17CF30.
Atty Stamman has no objection to the jail credit.  Requests the motion be set for motion/sentencing.

BY THE COURT:  Court accepts recommendation of state on 17CF40, Ct 6.  Court will lift the stay on the balance of the jail sentence and defendant is remanded to the Marquette County Jail to serve the remainder of the 144 days. 
As to the motion to terminate the DPA's and sentencing on 17CF40 & 17CF33, Court will set those matters for 2/7/18 at 9:00 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason J. Hunt in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Defendant Jason J. Hunt in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also appearing is members of the Treatment Court Team:  Atty Mark Gumz and Andrea Wilcox
17CF40, 16CF86, 16CM135 & 17CF33:
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion by the treatment court team to terminate the defendant from the program.  Court questions counsel.  Atty Stamman states that the defendant is opposing the termination and the defendant would still like to participate in the program.  Defendant makes a statement to the court.  Atty Hendee states multiple cases that are tracking.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Stamman; the defendant is stipulating to the evidence for the termination.
Atty Stamman agrees and is stipulating to the positive tests.   Atty Gumz questions the defendant.  Defendant responds.  Ms. Wilcox questions the defendant.  Atty Hendee questions the defendant.  Atty Gumz questions the defendant.  Atty Stamman states that the defendant would be willing to do in-patient treatment.  Atty Stamman makes arguments.  

BY THE COURT:  Motion to terminate the defendant from treatment court program is denied.

Atty Hendee asks to lift the stay of enough jail time to keep the defendant while waiting for the in-patient treatment.
Atty Stamman responds.  Atty Gumz asks that this be reviewed in 1 week to see the process of the in-patient program.

BY THE COURT:  Court will lift the jail stay from Sept. 20th until the defendant is transferred to in-patient program as ordered by the court.  There will be a weekly review by telephone to determine the process of the in-patient process.
Set for Telephone Review.
Marquette County Treatment Court Plea Agreement
for Leave to File Addtional Motions

16CM77, 16CM135 & 16CT105 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the PD office will be appointing counsel on the matters.  Court received a Attorney withdrawal from Atty Smerlinski.
Defendant states that he is going to be represented by public defender.

BY THE COURT:  Reset all matters.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jason J. Hunt in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has two other open cases and Atty Smerlinski is on one of those cases.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Freitag's grocery store
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
